cyclone.name: EMILY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving east across central Florida today, then turning northeast and accelerating offshore along the Southeast U.S. coast toward waters east of North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida peninsula (near the Tampa Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Anclote River to Englewood, Florida (west coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central Florida coast, then the Florida east coast and offshore waters northward to the Georgia and Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible mid-week; probability of sustained tropical-storm-force winds remains below 5%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Wilmington with current offshore track
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain bands possible late Wednesday into early Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and higher than normal swells could affect vessel approaches and pilot boarding areas.
